New Records: Jordan Walker had a five-hit game, the most since Matt Carpenter in 2018.
The St. Louis Cardinals set season highs for runs and hits (21) and were 8-for-18 with runners in scoring position.
Key Match Events: Lars Nootbaar hit a bases-clearing two-strike double in the seventh and a two-run homer in the ninth.
Victor Scott II hit an RBI double and scored on a throwing error by Phil Bickford.
Anthony Volpe hit an RBI single and Torres lifted a tying sacrifice fly in the sixth.
Pre-Game Insights: The St. Louis Cardinals were 0-7 in the regular season at Yankee Stadium before winning the final two games of the series.
Post-Match Reflections: The St. Louis Cardinals activated LHP Steven Matz and OF Michael Siani after their injuries.
The New York Yankees lost for the fourth time in six games and gave up their most hits since allowing 24 to Cleveland on Aug. 15, 2019.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the 100th meeting between the two teams.
The Yankees gave up their most hits since August 15, 2019.
Others: Steven Matz, who last appeared April 30, was activated after completing his rehab from a back injury and could start later this week.
Luis Gil threw 80 pitches in 3 2/3 innings in a rehab game for Double-A Somerset.
Clarke Schmidt and Ian Hamilton are set to return to the rotation next weekend against the Cubs in Chicago.
